title: Strange key problem when typing in ff, Ok in chrome
content:
I have a strange problem while typing in email, with hitting certain keys on the bottom row.

This began happening a few months ago. I did not know what was causing the problem, or what keys I was hitting that caused the problem till now.

Today, I was typing an email and got about half way down the page, and v and b would not work. v and b would not enter in the email.

And if I hit n, it caused the email to close and go to a new email window.

Sometimes the original email would go to draft, sometimes get deleted, sometimes gets sent. I had my technician clear cache, and it not help. Reloaded ff and did not help.

But all works good in chrome.

I have not had time to figure out if there are any other issues with other keys. Bc it is just too much work for me.

My tech said it is likely a programming or coding program anomoly.

title: Firefox constantly "freezes," not opening new tabs
content:
Recently Firefox started "freezing" several times a day, refusing to open new tabs or refresh most old ones. When this happens I have to close Firefox, wait a minute (it won't re-open quickly), and re-open.

I've tried steps 1-5 at https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/troubleshoot-and-diagnose-firefox-problems and nothing has worked. I've checked the Task Manager when this is happening and nothing seems to be slowing it down. I'm hesitant to get into #6.

The same thing started happening maybe 6 months to a year ago. I got so frustrated I decided to abandon Firefox entirely and exported all my bookmarks to Chrome. Several months later I tested the waters again and it has been working fine, until now - same thing.

Any ideas? I like keeping Chrome as my personal browser and Firefox for work.

title: Cookie permissions, just can't get the settings right
content:
Hey everyone,

this problem has been brought up many times before, but despite a fair bit of research, reading and tweaking the solutions I found so far just don't work for me.

I want to set up FF so it remembers my cookie permission for certain sites I use a lot. All other cookies shall be deleted once I quit the program.

But: Even when I disable virtually all privacy settings (custom > chose which > uncheck cookies, uncheck tracking), I'm asked for cookie permission again and again, every time I quit the program.

I added exceptions, did some reading on that subject too, tried full domains and specific sites, yet still I'm asked for cookie permission every time I quit the program.

I also tried to get the ForgetMeNot addon working, read up on how to set it up, but: The problem remains, I'm asked for cookie permission on those white-listed sites / domains every time I close and restart FF.

There must be a step-by-step guide how to work around this problem? Any advice where to find it, or any other advice what I'm doing wrong / what else to try?

I'm using the latest FF on a WIN10 system, I also have Avast Free Antivirus installed (looked into that, as well, but did not find any cookie-related settings that might interfere with FF).

Thanks for your support!
creator: tripdesign

title: New tab blank page and anchor problem
content:
Hello,

I have a weird problem.

When I click on a link, then it refreshes the page and scrolls me automatically to a new anchor position, it works fine.

When I open the same link with my middle mouse button as a new tab, the new page is blank (white). But then when I scroll up and down, all comes back. The annoying part is that the newly opened tab did not put the position to the correct anchor. It is on the buttom of the page. And as said it opens as a white page.

I tried uninstalling and reinstalling Firefox. But it is bugged somehow. I also deactivated all Firefox addons, same problem.

What can I do?

It is so annoying to open up bunch of links as new tabs, and all of them are on wrong positions. For example if I use a forum and click on the newest message in a thread, it should position the window to the latest message. It does not. It works perfectly if I am opening the same page on the current tab I am. But as a new tab, it does not work correctly.

Please help me.
